item.title: Addition
item.description: Let’s do some addition: x<-4 y<- 6 x+y ## [1] 10

item.title: subtraction
item.description: Let’s do some subtraction: x<-4 y<-9 x-y ## [1] -5

item.title: New Post
item.description: This is a blog about data science. I will use R to show examples R Studio is easy to use, here are the packages you will need: dplyr Lahman The dplyr package is a grammar of data manipulation. Lahman provides stats from the history of professional baseball. Examples First we must load packages: library(Lahman) library(dplyr) Then we can explore the data: Batting%>% filter(HR>50)%>% select(playerID,HR)%>% arrange(HR) ## playerID HR ## 1 kinerra01 51 ## 2 mizejo01 51 ## 3 mayswi01 51 ## 4 fieldce01 51 ## 5 jonesan01 51 ## 6 mantlmi01 52 ## 7 mayswi01 52 ## 8 fostege01 52 ## 9 mcgwima01 52 ## 10 rodrial01 52 ## 11 thomeji01 52 ## 12 davisch02 53 ## 13 ruthba01 54 ## 14 ruthba01 54 ## 15 kinerra01 54 ## 16 mantlmi01 54 ## 17 ortizda01 54 ## 18 rodrial01 54 ## 19 bautijo02 54 ## 20 wilsoha01 56 ## 21 griffke02 56 ## 22 griffke02 56 ## 23 gonzalu01 57 ## 24 rodrial01 57 ## 25 foxxji01 58 ## 26 greenha01 58 ## 27 howarry01 58 ## 28 ruthba01 59 ## 29 ruthba01 60 ## 30 marisro01 61 ## 31 sosasa01 63 ## 32 sosasa01 64 ## 33 mcgwima01 65 ## 34 sosasa01 66 ## 35 mcgwima01 70 ## 36 bondsba01 73
